Text.Value: He didn't - I had no idea.
Marcus was a True Soul. He said he was taking Isobel to Ketheric Thorm, but he died in the attempt. One of his ghouls grabbed her instead.
I see little more than a cowardly deception at play.

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (Ghoul holding Isobel (unconcious) on his arms)

Text.Value: Listen closely, for there's very little time. Even if Last Light falls, you must destroy the cult of the Absolute.

EditorData.NodeContext: desperate - recounting the story quickly and with urgency

Text.Value: As impossible as that task sounds, there must be a way to break the spell that makes him invincible. There are secrets in this ancient waste, hidden from...

EditorData.NodeContext: she's interrupted at the end

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (Dome started collapsing, Player and Jaheira notice and barge out from the inn)

Text.Value: It's happening. They'll all be taken by the shadows.
Even so, you must find him and you must kill him.
I don't see how she... Unless some cultist sneaked in, but gods, we'll be overrun!

EditorData.NodeContext: Frustration, trying to make sense of this, but there's no time.

EditorData.logicalname: Player saw Ghoul fly away with Isobel(KO)

Text.Value: I suppose I have no choice but to believe you.

EditorData.logicalname: Ghoul holding Isobel (unconcious) on his arms

Text.Value: Liar! It was you who killed her.

EditorData.NodeContext: Almost disbelieving. Horror.

Text.Value: Until then: to battle!
But hark! Something stirs...

EditorData.NodeContext: very tense

Text.Value: Behold, the consequences of your actions.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: |Protective barrier starts flickering and falling. Pockets of Shadow Blight rise around, suffocating the light.|
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Isobel was defeated after Marcus summoned the Ghouls, but before they were all killed. Marcus is alive to abduct her.
EditorData.logicalname: Marcus holding Isobel (unconcious) on his arms

Text.Value: Shit. This was your doing. All of it.
A little spat.

EditorData.NodeContext: Jaheira's eyes harden. the player just admitted to killing Isobel

Text.Value: There's no time for this, Jaheira; without Isobel, the shadows will overrun this place.
You're right. There's no stopping it now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Horror and anger.

Text.Value: Isobel and I got into a little spat.
He did. I thought it'd be fun to see what he had planned for you.
In this moment, you are the greater threat.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold fury

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: |Screams sound from inside the inn as the area is consumed by darkness as the inside goes dark. Player and Jaheira run out of front doors of inn.
EditorData.logicalname: Dome started collapsing, Player and Jaheira notice and barge out from the inn

Text.Value: And you had no idea? After Marcus vouched for you at the gate, he didn't confide in you?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira and player spot something overhead-- Marcus flying with a KO Isobel in his arms from the balcony toward Moonrise.
EditorData.logicalname: Heard flapping wing sound, player and Jaheira see Marcus flew away with unconcious Isobel

Text.Value: Behold, the consequences of your actions.
I can't believe I didn't see you for what you are. A murderer. You killed her, and in doing so you've spelled our doom.

EditorData.NodeContext: Furious, preparing to fight.

Text.Value: The Absolute's forces happened. Now we know what we're up against.
Gods spare us. Ketheric was planning our demise all along.
For a little while longer, you and I are destined to fight side by side, but if the shades don't take you, I have the next claim on your head.
There's no time for this. We have a shadow curse to deal with.
You wretch! To think you had my trust. If this be my last act, let it be in service of strangling the life out of you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Furious; leading to combat.

Text.Value: Listen closely, for there's very little time. Even if Last Light falls, your mission does not change: you must find Ketheric Thorm and you must kill him.

EditorData.NodeContext: desperate, with urgency

Text.Value: Liar. Filthy liar.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold disdain. She's about to fight you.

Text.Value: Steel your hearts and steady your hands. To battle!
Shit. This was your doing. All of it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player just committed an evil act (allowing Isobel to be kidnapped) and Wyll is aghast.

Text.Value: What were you thinking?! What are we doing here?

EditorData.NodeContext: Player just committed an evil act (allowing Isobel to be kidnapped) and Karlach is aghast.

Text.Value: He did, but I decided to handle him myself.
Blackguard! You're viler than the worm that's consuming you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Fury; the player has admitted to being a traitor

Text.Value: It looks like one of our enemies got hold of her.

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (Ghoul holding Isobel (unconcious) on his arms)

Text.Value: It's happening. They'll all be taken by the shadows. Only by the grace of Isobel's spell will we be spared the same fate.
She was my sacrifice. It was a delight.

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (Ghoul (Marcus dead) fly away with Isobel (KO))
Alias (Marcus & Ghoul dead, Jaheira seen player being aggro to Isobel.)

Text.Value: Harpers! We must cleanse...

EditorData.NodeContext: she's interrupted at the end

Text.Value: Isobel! No! What in the Nine Hells happened?

EditorData.logicalname: Player heard scream, Run out to check
Alias ( Marcus holding Isobel (unconcious) on his arms

Text.Value: Their leader is a man called Ketheric Thorm. He resides in Moonrise Towers, and we've found him to be impervious to the blade, and to magic to boot.
What were you thinking?! What are we doing here?

EditorData.NodeContext: Player just committed an evil act (allowing Isobel to be kidnapped) and Karlach is aghast.

Text.Value: You don't get to decide. Not here. Not while I'm responsible for the lives of the people at this inn.

EditorData.NodeContext: Furious. The player made a bad call and now everyone is screwed. Not shouting; cold fury.

Text.Value: Do you understand what you've done? Without Isobel, everyone in this inn is as good as dead!
So it begins. So it will end.
I gave you my trust too easily, but with the same ease I swear I'll strike you down.

EditorData.NodeContext: To her troops, elevated. About to start combat.

Text.Value: I helped Marcus kidnap Isobel. And now I'm going to watch the shadows consume you.
It looks like some kind of terrible accident.

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (Marcus holding Isobel (unconcious) on his arms)

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira and player spot something overhead-- a ghoul flying with a KO Isobel in his arms from the balcony toward Moonrise.
EditorData.logicalname: Ghoul (Marcus dead) fly away with Isobel (KO)
Alias (Heard flapping wing sound, player and Jaheira see Marcus flew away with unconcious Isobel)
Player saw Marcus fly away with Isobel(KO)

Text.Value: Isobel is gone. Soon the shadows will wash us all away.
Marcus was a True Soul. He said he was taking Isobel to Ketheric Thorm.
I trusted you. Silvanus forgive me, I let you in.
We cannot hesitate. Not even for those we knew - those we cared for. They're no longer who they were.
I was curious to see what you would do without her.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: |In front of the inn, a generic Harper is the first to transform: He appears to suffocate, then falls, gasping and screaming; he contorts (strained exhalation as the life is squeezed out of him), and rises again covered in Shadow Blight.|

Text.Value: Isobel. No! What in the Nine Hells happened?!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Running into position after seeing the barrier shimmer and break
EditorData.NodeContext: Subtext is that Isobel being captured spells death and doom for all remaining in the inn. Pause between 'Isobel, no!' and 'What the hells...' Jaheira is comprehending wtf happened and turns to the player for an explanation.

Synopsis: Huge cinematic showing start of the Shadow Siege. Jaheira assesses the situation with the players, urgently, as darkness takes over the inn. Then a legion of shadows tear the guards apart as everyone else flees, and the party emerges to fight.
